meanings.definition: Capable of being yielded or surrendered.
meanings.sent1: The yieldable land was easily plowed for planting crops.
meanings.sent2: The yieldable material could be molded into various shapes.
meanings.sent3: The yieldable fabric seemed to dance in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a yieldable canvas for creativity to paint upon.
meanings.sent5: The yieldable clay eagerly took on new forms under skilled hands.

meanings.definition: Able to produce or provide a return.
meanings.sent1: Investing in the yieldable stock brought steady profits.
meanings.sent2: The yieldable investment grew steadily over time.
meanings.sent3: The yieldable tree bore fruit abundantly every season.
meanings.sent4: Her efforts in the garden were a yieldable source of joy.
meanings.sent5: The yieldable machine churned out products efficiently.

meanings.definition: Willing to give in or comply.
meanings.sent1: She was yieldable in negotiations, always seeking compromise.
meanings.sent2: His yieldable nature made him a great team player.
meanings.sent3: The yieldable student eagerly followed the teacher's instructions.
meanings.sent4: In the face of reason, his stubbornness became yieldable.
meanings.sent5: The yieldable attitude of the group led to successful collaborations.
